intro: Linkia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny linkia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Linkia spinosa is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and humid environments.
